techmeme.title: Filing: chipmaker Microchip Technology says its servers were breached by an unauthorized party, causing its operations to run at "less than normal levels" (Nick Turner/Bloomberg)
A US appeals court revives a class action suit by Google Chrome users who say Google collected personal info even if Chrome was not synced with a Google account (Jonathan Stempel/Reuters)
Condé Nast makes a multiyear deal with OpenAI, letting ChatGPT and SearchGPT surface stories from The New Yorker, Vogue, Vanity Fair, Bon Appetit, and Wired (Kate Knibbs/Wired)
OpenAI launches fine-tuning for GPT-4o, which lets developers customize a version of the model with their own datasets to improve domain-specific performance (OpenAI)
Flight tracking site FlightAware, which claims 10M+ monthly users, reports a breach dating back to January 2021 that exposed names, SSNs, addresses, and more (Zack Whittaker/TechCrunch)
